Case reference: 2014006505.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2014, Sandra Mensah was seen for the last time in the Cartierville district of Montreal, Quebec. Her boyfriend came to pick her up at her home during the evening. Sandra has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018043199.CaseDesc: In December of 1995, Myung Lim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Myung and his wife had an argument and he told her he was returning to South Korea.

Case reference: 2015011629.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2013 a man was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River on the banks of the Bellerive Park. He had a new cigarette pack, still packed in his right pocket of his coat. The man wore his watch on the left wrist. A backpack was found near the body in which there were clothes and an English book by JJR Tolkien "The Lord of the Rings".

Boots: Leather, Black, Dakota working boots; size 10; yellow sole
Coat: Black, President Stone with a hoodie; size XL
Hat: Black, Nascar racing cap written "Dupont Motor Sport" on top
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Milano brand watch
Shirt: Cotton, Dark Blue, Red, checkered; size XXL; written "Street Legal"

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2013000079.CaseDesc: Gilles Chiasson has been missing from Montreal since April 18, 1995. Mr. Chiasson took a taxi after a night out in a bar and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014042438.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2014, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Delaram Hashemi was seen for the last time leaving her home in Toronto, Ontario. Delaram had told her mother that she would be attending a party and would return home at 10:00 p.m., but she never returned.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2014002433.CaseDesc:
On April 13, 1995, Wendy Smith was last seen leaving the Fantasia strip club
formerly located on 10097 Yonge Street in Richmond Hill, Ontario. Wendy had 
her first shift there that night, and was due to return to her home in Toronto later
that night, but never arrived.

Foreign Object: Cheek, Metal plate on the right
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Two six inch scars

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2014001192.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1983, the partial remains of a young adult male were found on the south side of Cracroft Island. He was partially clothed in a wetsuit, and may have been out fishing when he went missing. The last joint of the little finger on his left hand was amputated. He is estimated to have gone missing sometime in 1982 or 1983.

Pants: Cloth, Gold, Small sweatpants with drawstring waist
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Little Finger, Amputation of left pinky finger

Case reference: 2014005893.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2012, Timothy Colbon was seen for the last time as he left a residence, without wearing any shoes, in Elk Lake, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Timothy had travelled with friends from London, Ontario to Elk Lake.

Case reference: 2014005149.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2008, Zelalem Assefa was last seen visiting relatives in Calgary, Alberta. Zelalem is from Ethiopia and had only been in Canada for about a year and a half when he disappeared.

Case reference: 2015007263.CaseDesc: Nuseiba Husan was last seen in Flamborough, Ontario on November 30, 2006. Originally from Jordan, Nuseiba frequently travels home.

Case reference: 2023031245.CaseDesc:
On June 14, 2023, Cody Higbee was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.  Cody is known to spend time in the areas near Chinook Centre and in the Bridlewood area near the ctrain lines.

Cody has a medical condition and may be confused or disoriented.

Tattoo: Left Arm, "WHAT YOU GIVE IS WHAT YOU GET"

Case reference: 2019029100.CaseDesc: Robert Allen Wetsch was reported missing by family on May 19, 2019. There have not been any confirmed sightings of him since.

Case reference: 2014004298.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2002, Spencer Shinjo Aoki left his apartment in Vancouver, British Columbia and never returned. Spencer did not take any personal items with him and left behind things that were of high value to him.

Case reference: 2014003163.CaseDesc: John Timothy McCarthy was last seen in Red Deer, Alberta on May 1, 1991. His van was located in Sault St Marie, Ontario, however it is not known if he stayed in the Ontario region or went on to the United States.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Wedding ring with small diamonds

Case reference: 2014001798.CaseDesc: On March 3, 1987, Nancy Dumas was reported missing. She was last seen by her daughter. Nancy had said that she was going to find her friends, and left her daughter's residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001879.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Patrick Auger left his residence in Desmarais, Alberta, to travel to Slave Lake, Alberta. On November 1, 1983, Patrick was observed getting onto a Greyhound Bus bound for Peace River, Alberta, from Slave Lake.

Deformity: Right Fourth Toe, Deformed from previous fracture
Right Large Toe, Toe twisted from healed fracture

Case reference: 2014024200.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2014, Noel Yassinsky was reported missing in Kitimat , British Columbia.  On September 17, 2014, Noel’s vehicle was located abandoned west of Prince George, near Purden Campground.  Noel’s disappearance is out of character and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008023399.CaseDesc: Christine Ziomkiewicz was last seen on June 23, 1978, by co-workers at Queen's University, where she worked as a laboratory technician. Her vehicle was still in the building’s parking lot and there was nothing to indicate she had left intentionally for any period of time. She is not believed to have been in a relationship at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005576.CaseDesc: Daniel Dumigan's family lost contact with him in July of 1975. They received information that he was planning to leave for Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2013000063.CaseDesc: Pierre-Paul Proulx was reported missing to the Service de police de la Ville de Montreal on August 21, 2002. He was last seen in Montreal on August 8, 2002 when he left his apartment located in the Plateau du Mont-Royal district with his vehicle after receiving a phone call.

Pierce: Ears, Gold loop in left ear

Case reference: 2014004457.CaseDesc: Stephon Payne was last seen at his residence on October 6, 2002. On the same day, Stephon was seen in the area of 106 Avenue and 84 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. Stephon may have also been in the area of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton. A jacket believed to be Stephon’s was found at the bridge.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Heart with dagger

Case reference: 2014004704.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 24, 2000, René Rosa was seen for the last time at his residence in La Minerve, Quebec. On this day, at approximately 2:40 p.m., René’s vehicle, a 1996 purple Chevrolet Cavalier, was found abandoned near Montée Charette in La Minerve. René has not been seen and we have not heard from him since.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Engraved bracelet
Tattoo: Upper Back, Naked woman and atomic mushroom cloud

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2013000031.CaseDesc: On October 31, 2007, Edward D’Souza went missing from his home in Oakville, Ontario. Investigators believe that Mr. D’Souza travelled to Mumbai, India and may now be living in the Middle East under an assumed name.

Case reference: 2014004274.CaseDesc: Frédéric Cormier was last seen on January 11, 2001, in the Vieux-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. Frédéric would pick up his son once a week, but he has had no contact since this date.

Case reference: 2014006393.CaseDesc: In June 2002, Edward Decoyne was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Edward has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2015061728.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 25, 1967, Alphonse Brochu left his residence to deliver documents to a government agency in Ottawa, Ontario. That same day, Mr. Brochu’s vehicle was located on the Champlain Bridge, which connects Ottawa to Gatineau, Quebec.

Boots: Black, Rubber on the toe area
Shoes: Black, Rubber on the toe area

Case reference: 2014002600.CaseDesc: On April 10th, 1976, at approximately 3:00 am, a snowmobile carrying two adults and a young child, went through harbor ice at North West River, Newfoundland and Labrador. The young child, Stella Mary Rich, was swept under the ice after falling off the snowmobile when it struck a soft spot in the ice. Her body has never been located and it is presumed she drowned.

Case reference: 2014003874.CaseDesc: Marthe Turcotte was last seen in Montreal on September 13, 1971. Her sister dropped her off at the Jean-Talon metro station but she was never seen again. Marthe was a student in Nursing at Thetford CEGEP in Thetford Mines.

Case reference: 2012020660.CaseDesc: Hamza Alsharief has not been heard from by friends or family members since December 14, 2011. Originally from Saudi Arabia, Mr. Alsharief is a student studying at the University of Saskatchewan. While foul play is not suspected at this time, family members say it is unusual that he has had no contact with them.

Hair: Brown, Short, Short to medium length
Mark: Lower Lip, Small growth of facial hair

Case reference: 2018041855.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1992, Grayce Baxter was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. She was a known transgendered sex trade worker. She had a transaction with Patrick Johnson who subsequently confessed to her homicide. Grayce’s remains were never recovered.

Coat: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Fur, Full length coat

Case reference: 2022000648.CaseDesc: Murray Marsden went missing from Calgary, Alberta, sometime between April 29, 2010, and December 28, 2021.

Deformity: Left Hand, Left hand fingers are flexed
Scar: Left Eye, Scar located in left eyebrow

Case reference: 2007002799.CaseDesc: Amanda Rudge was last seen by her mother at her residence on Enfield Place, Mississauga in August of 1991. At the time she went missing, Amanda was known to frequent the Bloor and Landsdowne area of Toronto. Amanda may have connections to the United States.

Hair: Auburn, Other, Natural Auburn dyed Blonde
Teeth: Broken Front Tooth which had been fixed
Pierce: Ears, Several piercings in both ears
Tattoo: Left Foot, APBT letters on her left toes

Case reference: 2013000144.CaseDesc: Robert Angelo Furgiuele from Sault Ste-Marie, Ontario was last seen in Squamish, British-Columbia in 1991. He was residing in Squamish with his girlfriend and his daughter. He was working in a grocery store at the time. He last spoke to his mother by telephone in 1991. He might have moved to Vancouver Island, British-Columbia in 1992.

Case reference: 2018063001.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1995, at around midnight, Ying Zhu was last seen by her boyfriend when he dropped her off at her home in Toronto, Ontario. The following day, her boyfriend arrived at Ying’s work to pick her up and found out that she had quit her job the previous week.

Case reference: 2018000324.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2006, Freda Whiteman was seen for the last time at the York Hotel in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004438.CaseDesc: Catherine Smith was last seen leaving a party in Spryfield, Nova Scotia in 1964.

Case reference: 2019026482.CaseDesc: Kristofer Couture drove his vehicle from Alberta to the lower mainland in British Columbia to find work and had cut off ties from his family. Kristofer worked construction for a short period of time while living in his vehicle near Maple Ridge, British Columbia. Kristofer also frequented a gym in Burnaby, British Columbia. Kristofer was last seen leaving the Royal Columbian Hospital in New Westminster, British Columbia on January 26, 2019. His unoccupied vehicle was seen the following day parked at the Elk Mountain Trail in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Kristofer was reported missing on May 17, 2019 and his vehicle was found parked at the same location.

Case reference: 2014004516.CaseDesc: On March 19 2004, Daniel James Murray was reported missing to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel slipped on ice and fell into the North Saskatchewan River in the area of Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018034585.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2004, at approximately 8:00 am, Stephen Lawrence was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Stephen had said he would be home in a few hours.

Shirt: Blue, Brand: Calvin Klein; long sleeves

Case reference: 2024016887.CaseDesc: Maggie JACKNIFE was last seen in Rocky Rapids, Alberta around October, 1960.

Case reference: 2014004031.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1974, Earland Christopher Feldseth was seen for the last time at a grocery store in Tofino, British Columbia. On April 11, 1974, Earland had set sail on a fishing trip on his 39-foot Fishing Trawler from Steveston Fisherman's Wharf in Richmond, British Columbia, with his 1969 Triumph motorcycle secured to the stern. Earland has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014001632.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Dorion was last seen by a friend at a local fishing camp on September 21, 1999. Ms. Dorion arrived at the fishing camp on the 17th of September with her friends and stayed there approximately 4 days. She was never seen again. Two separate ground searches were carried out. Several steep embankments as well as the area surrounding the camp were searched with negative results. Ms. Dorion's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2021055005.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2016, Karen Thompson was last seen at her daughter’s birthday party at Prince of Whales Park in Toronto, Ontario.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Elephant on left or right shoulder
Lower Back, 3 skulls on lower back

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2014001782.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1972, Kenneth Kay was seen for the last time as he attended the First Nation Treaty days in Quinton, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2024010813.CaseDesc: Earl Aragona was reported missing on February 4, 2024 by family members. Earl’s vehicle was later located abandoned in a parking lot near the Goat Island Bridge in Niagara Falls, New York, USA.

Hair: Black, Short, Full black and grey beard

Case reference: 2018062818.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1993, at approximately 1:30am, Rafat Abugazia was last seen by his roommate in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003404.CaseDesc: Armand Comtois was reported missing on May 2, 1985. At the time of his disappearance he was living in Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec. He was seen by a family member on March 9, 1985 but he has not been seen or heard from since this date. He also used the name of "Simon".

Teeth: Dental appliance, partial composed of 4 upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014001538.CaseDesc: During the month of March, 1998, Theresa Johnny was seen for the last time in Whitehorse, Yukon. The last known contact with Theresa was on July 18, 1998, with the Anchorage Police Department in Alaska, United States. Over the years, there have been a number of unconfirmed tips received about Theresa’s location and well being.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2014005762.CaseDesc: On April 25, 2011, Yuji Fujita was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Yuji had called in sick to work on April 26 and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004181.CaseDesc: On July 2, 1984, Yves Jodouin was seen for the last time as he was dropped off at a venue in Ottawa, Ontario. Yves had received permission to leave the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario to attend a show. Later that evening, he had phoned his family to advise he would be running late.

Case reference: 2014005998.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2013, Joshua Miller was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Purple shirt with black stripes

Case reference: 2014006306.CaseDesc: Shelly Dene was reported missing to the EPS by a family member on November 8, 2013. She had been out of family contact since approximately August 2013. Family is concerned for her welfare as it is unusual for her to be out of contact for this length of time. Shelly resided in Kelowna BC before moving to Edmonton in June 2013.

Case reference: 2013000102.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1981 at approximately 7:30 p.m., Lawrence (Larry) Bennett left Princess Harbour, Manitoba in his boat heading for Matheson Island. He left with his sheepdog, and the trip should have taken 20-25 minutes. When he left he was traveling straight into the wind, and the water was reported as being rough. Lawrence (Larry) never arrived at Matheson Island. Lawrence (Larry) is presumed to have drowned, his remains have never been recovered.

Coveralls: Grey, Grey coveralls with black stripe

Case reference: 2014004485.CaseDesc: Pablo Guerra was reported missing by his family on May 10, 2004. He had no health issues. Pablo's jacket was located in a body of water under the Second Narrows Bridge by Vancouver City Police Marine Section the day Pablo was last seen.

Jacket: Black, North Face embroidered on left breast

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2014004377.CaseDesc: On October 3, 2003, a family member contacted Police and reported that ROSS had been missing since the evening of October 1st. She indicated ROSS and his cousin were drinking together that night and that on their way home his cousin lost sight of ROSS in the bushes. ROSS did not return home. Numerous sightings were reported to police in the days following ROSS' disappearance however no one spoke directly to ROSS. As a result these sightings are unconfirmed. Further unconfirmed sightings were reported across Canada as well and were investigated. ROSS has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2022048901.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2021, at approximately 7:33 a.m., Madison Roy-Boudreau was seen for the last time when she was picked up in a vehicle driven by a man at the corner of Assaff and Grange Streets in Bathurst, New Brunswick. Madison has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019016353.CaseDesc: On March 13 2019, Michael Steele was seen for the last time at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital Emergency Department in Sydney, Nova Scotia.

Case reference: 2014005617.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1995, Bradley Wiesner was on an island in Manitou Lake, Saskatchewan, in the company of other individuals. He was seen for the last time at approximately 8:00 pm when he was swimming towards the boat they were using as it had started to float away from shore.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Necklace with a silver ring on it
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Wylie Coyote holding a beer mug

Case reference: 2014001801.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1992, Marshall Holmes wandered into the bush near Vassar, Manitoba and has not been seen since. Mr. Holmes was 73 years old at the time and was described as a recluse and a hermit. Mr. Holmes had gone missing in the past and had returned on his own accord. He enjoyed being in the bush and liked to sleep in the long grass. The last time he went missing he was gone for 3 days and came out of the bush when he became hungry. Extensive searches were done by land, air and with the assistance of a police dog. Marshall Holmes has never been located.

Jacket: Nylon, Blue, White, Has 3 vertical stripes

Case reference: 2014003746.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1972, Mario Cardinal was reported missing by his family. At the time of his disappearance, he lived in Trois-Rivières, Quebec.

Case reference: 2021036430.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2012, John Fruehauf was last seen near the American Falls located at Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, John was despondent.

Shirt: Other, Light coloured worn underneath the long sleeve.
Other, Dark coloured with long sleeves

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2024028148.CaseDesc: Robert “Bob” Austin was on the phone with family members, on June 4, 2024.  During the phone call he advised them that he was at his home in Baysville, Ontario.  His family reported him missing on June 5, 2024, after they attended his residence and he wasn’t there.

Case reference: 2012020062.CaseDesc: On July 15, 2000 Marcus McKay went hunting with his step father and three others.  Marcus and his step father broke apart from the group to hunt on their own. Some time later, the pair successfully felled a deer. Marcus was to stay with the deer while his step father went to get help from their friends. When his stepfather returned Marcus was no where to be found. He was last seen 10 km north of Mallard and Bison Road.

Case reference: 2006009499.CaseDesc: On February 23, 2003, Fred Takerer was reported missing by his son. Mr. Takerer had physical limits and was not able to get around easily. Police have not been able to locate Mr. Takerer and believe his disappearance to be suspicious.

Case reference: 2014002008.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1999, Pierre Bédard was seen for the last time while he left his home in Levis, Quebec. Mr. Bédard’s vehicle was located at Anse Benson in the St- Romuald neighbourhood in Levis.

Case reference: 2014006708.CaseDesc: On April 22nd, 2014 Andrew George Nicoll was reported missing from his home near Breton, Alberta. He was last seen on April 20, 2014. Extensive searches of his property and the surrounding county were conducted by ground and air. Mr. Nicoll has not been located.

Case reference: 2022052659.CaseDesc: On October 16, 2022, Bradley Kiefer was seen for the last time by his family in Medicine Hat, Alberta. At the time of his disappearance, all of Bradley’s personal belongings, and vehicle were left at his residence.

Case reference: 2014002578.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1979, Martin Corbet was seen for the last time as he went hunting in the woods.

Hat: Wool, Yellow, Toque; Yellow, Black, Orange

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2024034158.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dinwoodie was last seen in the early morning hours of July 4, 2024, in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020111.CaseDesc: On July 15 2010, James Daniel Khan left the family home for a walk and never returned. He suffers from mental health problems and he left without his medication.

Case reference: 2008018199.CaseDesc: Carl Braum and Thomas Lumsden were last seen on the morning of May 19, 1974, in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe, travelling in a northerly direction in the area of Depot Harbor. It was believed that they were travelling to the Killbear Park area. There were no lifejackets in the canoe.

Case reference: 2014004643.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2002, Carol Tuks was last seen while exiting a Greyhound bus in Red Deer, Alberta.

Pierce: Ears, single piercing in each ear

Case reference: 2014005512.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2010, Ivana Ferus was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario, to catch a flight destined for the Czech Republic. Ivana’s apartment keys were subsequently found in a recycling bin.

Case reference: 2013000089.CaseDesc: Daniel Marceau was last seen on June 7, 1989 in Montréal. He was despondent, and told a friend that he was going up north to reflect on his life.

Case reference: 2013000065.CaseDesc: Pierrette Courcelles was last seen on November 22, 1991 in Montreal.

Tattoo: Right Arm, picture of a heart, a cross and an eagle with "ROBERT" (text)

Case reference: 2016013490.CaseDesc: On March 15, 2016, Ravishankar Vallepuram was seen for the last time at his residence in Scarborough, Ontario. Ravishankar has never gone missing in the past, nor has he spent the night away from his residence.

Case reference: 2021030112.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2021, Jeanette Marcotte was reported missing in Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette was last seen in Saskatchewan in 1981 or 1982, where she stated that she was headed to Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005612.CaseDesc: Carol Handy was last seen on March 16, 2011 in Edmonton, Alberta. Her family heard her leave her bedroom at approximately 2:30 am. She has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005271.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2009, Fanzheng Meng was seen for the last time at Britannia Park and Beach in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Meng and another man had been aboard an inflatable raft on the Ottawa River. The two men did not return to the shore and the deflated raft was subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014005052.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2007, Ohanes Melkon was last seen when he departed his residence located in Innisfail, Alberta to go purchase food.

Case reference: 2017009362.CaseDesc: Badri Prasad Bhattarai, was reported missing on February 21, 2017, after his family became concerned that he had not been in contact with them. It is believed that his last known location was in the area of the Walterdale Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta. Badri’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being.

Chain: Black, Volkswagen Key Fob, House, Locker and mailbox keys
Key Ring with the letter "R" and a Swedish Flag
Ring: Gold, With 3 small clear stones worn on the left ring finger
Scar: Black dots, diabetes scars on both shins

Case reference: 2020011631.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1975, at approximately 8:30 am, Simon Wilson was seen for the last time as he left his home for school in Toronto, Ontario. Simon did not arrive at school.

Case reference: 2012020114.CaseDesc: Sebastien Metivier went missing in Montreal, Quebec on November 1, 1984. The young boy was in front of the Tres-Saint-Nom-de-Jesus church on the east side of the city and he was heading to an arts and crafts course.

Pants: Blue, Patch on the right knee
